headline: Ford, Xiaomi Deny JV Talks Even As Jim Farley Expressed Admiration For Chinese EVs While Flagging Them As Competitive Threat
summary: Ford Motor Co. (NYSE:F) and Chinese tech giant Xiaomi (OTC:XIACF) have both denied reports of a potential collaboration to produce electric vehicles in the United States. Ford Reportedly Held Preliminary Talks With Xiaomi The Financial Times reported that Ford had preliminary discussions with Xiaomi about a joint venture, aiming to facilitate Chinese carmakers’ entry into the U.S. market. headline: Ford Xiaomi Talks Highlight Questions On Xiaomi’s Global EV Ambitions
summary: Reports indicate Ford and Xiaomi (SEHK:1810) have discussed a partnership that could help Chinese EV makers access the U.S. market. Both companies have publicly denied that a deal is currently in place or being finalized. The news has drawn attention because it touches on EV competition, tech auto partnerships, and geopolitical sensitivities around Chinese brands entering the U.S. Xiaomi, best known for smartphones and consumer electronics, has been expanding into electric vehicles as part...

headline: Ford Energy Launch Adds New Dimension To Ford Motor Valuation
summary: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) has launched a new battery energy storage business called Ford Energy. Lisa Drake has been appointed president of Ford Energy to lead the battery energy storage systems (BESS) initiative. Ford plans significant investment in the business, with operations expected to begin within 18 months. For you as an investor, Ford’s move into battery energy storage adds a new line of business alongside its core automotive operations. The company is looking to apply its battery...

headline: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.

raw.headline: Tesla Stock Falls. Ford Could Help Bring Chinese EVs to America.
raw.summary: Tesla  stock fell early Monday after a report that  Ford Motor  was considering a collaboration with Chinese electric-vehicle makers.  Shares of Elon Musk’s EV company were down 2.2% at $420.95 in premarket trading, while  and  futures were off 0.5% and 0.1%, respectively.  The move came after a Financial Times report that Ford has held discussions with China’s  Xiaomi  and  BYD  to help bring Chinese EVs into America.
